excerpt: Venue featuring over 2,000 butterflies flying in enclosed, rainforest surroundings.
detail_description: The Butterfly Conservatory is a captivating venue where you can witness over 2,000 butterflies fluttering in a lush rainforest setting. It's one of the many must-see attractions at Niagara Falls State Park, offering an immersive experience with nature. The conservatory provides an opportunity to observe these beautiful creatures up close and learn about their habitat. It's a perfect family-friendly destination that offers an educational and enchanting experience for visitors of all ages.
name: Butterfly Conservatory
address: 2565 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L0S 1J0, Canada

excerpt: Antique cable cars carrying visitors above the Niagara River & its unique whirlpool since 1916.
detail_description: The Whirlpool Aero Car has been carrying visitors above the Niagara River and its unique whirlpool since 1916. This antique cable car offers a thrilling experience as it suspends passengers over the river, providing breathtaking views of the swirling whirlpool below. The attraction is part of a range of sightseeing activities available in the area, including boat trips, historical museums, and natural wonders like Niagara Falls State Park. Visitors can also explore local culture, dining options, and budget-friendly accommodations nearby.
name: Whirlpool Aero Car
address: 3850 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 7M8, Canada

excerpt: Observation tower featuring sweeping vistas of Niagara Falls plus an arcade & revolving restaurant.
detail_description: The Skylon Tower is a must-visit attraction in Niagara Falls, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the falls and the surrounding area. At 775 feet above the ground, visitors can enjoy sweeping vistas from both indoor and outdoor observation decks. The tower also features a unique revolving restaurant where guests can savor continental cuisine while taking in the stunning sights. Additionally, there's an arcade and the opportunity to watch the 2D/4D film 'Legends of Niagara Falls.'
name: Skylon Tower
address: 5200 Robinson St, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 2A2, Canada

excerpt: Sweeping panoramas of Niagara Falls from glass-enclosed gondolas reaching heights of 175 ft.
detail_description: The Niagara SkyWheel is Canada's largest observation wheel, offering stunning panoramic views of the Horseshoe and American Falls, the Niagara River, and other landmarks. The glass-enclosed gondolas reach heights of 175 feet, providing a comfortable vantage point for visitors to enjoy the breathtaking scenery in any season. With heating and air conditioning in each gondola, guests can take in the beauty of Niagara Falls year-round.
name: Niagara SkyWheel
address: 4960 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N4, Canada

excerpt: Year-round site with Horseshoe Falls views from below & behind via tunnels & observation decks.
detail_description: Experience the natural wonder of Horseshoe Falls from a unique perspective at Journey Behind the Falls. This year-round attraction offers visitors the chance to view the falls from below and behind through tunnels and observation decks. To reach this vantage point, guests descend 45 meters in an elevator before traveling through a 50-meter tunnel that leads to two observation platforms located at the bottom of the waterfall.
name: Journey Behind the Falls
address: 6650 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6T2, Canada

excerpt: Niagara Falls, Ontario, is a Canadian city at the famous waterfalls of the same name, linked with the U.S. by the Rainbow Bridge. Its site on the Niagara River's western shore overlooks the Horseshoe Falls, the cascades' most expansive section. Elevators take visitors to a lower, wetter vantage point behind the falls. A cliffside park features a promenade alongside 520-ft.-high Skylon Tower with an observation deck.
detail_description: Niagara Falls, located in Ontario, Canada, is a city known for its famous waterfalls and stunning views. The Horseshoe Falls, the most expansive section of the falls, can be seen from the western shore of the Niagara River. Visitors can take elevators to get a closer look at the falls from behind and enjoy a promenade alongside the 520-ft.-high Skylon Tower with an observation deck.
name: Niagara Falls
address: Ontario, Canada

excerpt: Landmark, bustling street featuring a giant Ferris wheel, mini-golf, a wax museum & restaurants.
detail_description: Clifton Hill is a bustling street in the city, offering a wide range of attractions and activities. Visitors can enjoy classic midway games at the Great Canadian Midway and win tickets for prizes. The Niagara Parks Adventure Pass provides access to top attractions like Journey Behind the Falls and Hornblower Niagara Cruises. For those seeking entertainment, Clifton Hill features a casino and family-friendly attractions such as the iconic Niagara Skywheel, offering panoramic views of the city near the falls.
name: Clifton Hill
address: Niagara Falls, ON, Canada

excerpt: Open since 1936, European-style gardens with 40 hectares of allees, roses, herbs & vegetables.
detail_description: Established in 1936, the Niagara Parks Botanical Gardens is a sprawling European-style garden spanning 40 hectares. It showcases an array of plants from around the globe, including allees, roses, herbs, and vegetables. The site also houses one of Canada's largest conservatories where visitors can observe butterflies up close and partake in educational programs focused on horticulture. Additionally, the gardens offer indoor and outdoor spaces for students to learn about plant life and for families to enjoy nature.
name: Niagara Parks Botanical Gardens
address: 2565 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 2S7, Canada

excerpt: Attraction offering wooden walkways & ponchos for an up-close & wet view of the Bridal Veil Falls.
detail_description: Cave of the Winds is a must-see attraction near Prospect Point, offering an up-close and wet view of Bridal Veil Falls. Visitors are provided with ponchos and wooden walkways that take them within twenty feet of the thunderous falls on the hurricane deck. While it's guaranteed to get soaked, this experience provides some of the best close-up views of the falls in town.
name: Cave of the Winds
address: 10 Goat Island Rd, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

detail_description: Niagara City Cruises is a must-do experience in Niagara Falls, offering a thrilling adventure as you cruise through the mist at the base of the Horseshoe Falls. Often confused with Maid of the Mist, this popular attraction provides a relaxing yet exhilarating journey along the towering walls of the Niagara Escarpment.
name: Niagara City Cruises
address: 5920 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6X8, Canada

excerpt: Long-running outfit offering scenic boat tours from the foot of Niagara Falls, since 1846.
detail_description: The Maid of the Mist is a historic boat tour that has been operating since 1846, offering visitors a scenic and immersive experience at Niagara Falls. Passengers board a double-deck steamboat at the Observation Tower, where they are provided with souvenir rain ponchos before embarking on an unforgettable journey. The boat takes guests past the base of the American Falls and towards the basin of Horseshoe Falls, allowing them to get up close to the powerful cascades and massive rock formations.
name: Maid of the Mist
address: 1 Prospect St, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

excerpt: Elevator ride down to a tunnel and connecting boardwalk overlooking a large stretch of rapids.
detail_description: Experience the power and beauty of the largest rapids in North America at White Water Walk, located just four kilometers downstream of Niagara Falls. After a quick elevator ride, visitors can stroll along a wooden boardwalk that runs alongside the river through the narrow Niagara Gorge, offering stunning views of rock layers dating back over 400 million years.
name: White Water Walk
address: 4330 River Rd, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 6T2, Canada

excerpt: Historic park with carpet bedding/seasonal flower gardens, horse-drawn carriage tours & a gift shop.
detail_description: Queen Victoria Park is a historic and picturesque park located at the heart of the Niagara Parks. It offers a visual spectacle throughout the seasons, featuring beautiful flower gardens and horse-drawn carriage tours. The park celebrates every season with stunning displays, from spring daffodils to winter frost on tree branches.
name: Queen Victoria Park
address: 6345 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6X8, Canada

excerpt: Pedestrian-friendly bridge offering picturesque views of Niagara Falls, often including rainbows.
detail_description: The Rainbow International Bridge is a pedestrian-friendly bridge that provides stunning views of Niagara Falls, often adorned with rainbows. This iconic structure was completed in 1941 after the collapse of its predecessor, the Honeymoon Bridge. Renowned for its architectural beauty and outstanding vistas, the bridge earned its name from an engraving of a passage from the Book of Genesis referencing the bow in the cloud.
name: Rainbow International Bridge
address: 3WRJ+4X, Rainbow Bridge, 5702 Falls Ave, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6T8, Canada

excerpt: This facility for visitors offers guided hiking tours & a picnic pavilion, plus snacks & souvenirs.
detail_description: The Niagara Glen Nature Centre, located near the Niagara River, is a picturesque nature destination offering guided hiking tours through rugged paths in the Carolinian Forest and along the Niagara River Whirlpool. Visitors can also enjoy bouldering and a picnic pavilion, as well as snacks and souvenirs. This serene pocket of nature has been designated as an official Nature Reserve since 1992 and provides stunning views of lush forest and spectacular boulders left behind by the Falls thousands of years ago.
name: Niagara Glen Nature Centre
address: 3050 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 3G8, Canada

excerpt: Famous waterfalls steal the show at this park that also features an aquarium, restaurant & more.
detail_description: Niagara Falls State Park is a renowned destination featuring the iconic waterfalls, as well as an aquarium and a variety of attractions such as Maid of the Mist boat trips, Journey Behind the Falls, Cave of the Winds, and Whirlpool Aero Cars. Visitors can also explore Niagara Falls Botanical Gardens & Butterfly Conservatory, Bird Kingdom, and Herschell Carrousel Factory Museum. The area offers diverse dining options and accommodations for different budgets.
name: Niagara Falls State Park
address: 332 Prospect St, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

excerpt: This popular, time-tested destination features a large clock face made of colorful flowerbeds.
detail_description: The Floral Clock is a popular and well-established destination featuring a large clock face created with vibrant flowerbeds. Situated near the Centennial Lilac Gardens, this impressive display boasts 16,000 bedding plants that are changed twice a year. The clock's mechanism can be viewed by visitors when the tower door is open, along with historical photos showcasing its designs dating back to the 1950s.
name: Floral Clock
address: 14004 Niagara River Pkwy, Queenston, ON L0S 1L0, Canada

excerpt: Family-friendly indoor water park with a wave pool, slides for all ages & an outdoor sun deck.
detail_description: Fallsview Indoor Waterpark is a family-friendly destination offering a variety of water attractions suitable for all ages. The park features a wave pool, numerous slides, and an outdoor sun deck. Visitors can enjoy the massive tipping bucket, large wave pool, and year-round outdoor activity pool spread across three acres. The park also includes the Tiny Tots Splash Park area designed for toddlers and preschoolers, as well as thrilling slides like Drop Canyon and Sky Screamer for older kids.
name: Fallsview Indoor Waterpark
address: 5685 Falls Ave, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6W7, Canada

excerpt: Zip line attraction with panoramic views of Niagara Falls, offering rides during the day & night.
detail_description: Experience the exhilarating WildPlay Niagara Falls Zipline to the Falls at Grand View Marketplace, offering day and night rides with panoramic views of both American and Canadian waterfalls. This thrilling 670-meter journey takes you soaring over the Niagara River Gorge towards the majestic Canadian Horseshoe Falls. From a height of 67 meters, riders dangle from four parallel ziplines, reaching speeds of over 70 kph as they enjoy unparalleled vistas of this natural wonderland.
name: WildPlay Niagara Falls Zipline to the Falls
address: 5920 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6X8, Canada

excerpt: Venue featuring birds & reptiles, plus the biggest free-flying indoor aviary in the world.
detail_description: Bird Kingdom is a must-visit venue in Niagara Falls, offering an unforgettable experience with its diverse collection of birds and reptiles. It boasts the title of the largest free-flying indoor aviary globally, providing a unique opportunity to witness over 400 birds from 80 different species in a multi-level rainforest habitat. This award-winning attraction allows visitors to observe beautiful tropical birds, many of which are endangered in the wild, flying freely within their enclosure.
name: Bird Kingdom
address: 5651 River Rd, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 7M7, Canada

excerpt: Small aquatic center housing different species, interactive exhibits & kid-friendly shows.
detail_description: The Aquarium of Niagara is a popular destination for families, offering an immersive experience with over 200 species of aquatic life. Visitors can explore 20 themed exhibits showcasing a diverse range of creatures including seals, sea lions, penguins, sharks, stingrays, and colorful fish. The aquarium provides both entertainment and education through live demonstrations and feeding sessions. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the nearby Maid of The Mist boat tour and the Cave of the Winds attraction for an unforgettable experience at Niagara Falls.
name: Aquarium of Niagara
address: 701 Whirlpool St, Niagara Falls, NY 14301, USA

excerpt: Company offering 12-minute helicopter rides over Niagara Falls & the Niagara River region.
detail_description: Niagara Helicopters Limited provides an unforgettable experience with 12-minute helicopter rides over Niagara Falls and the surrounding region. Departing from their headquarters just a short drive from Table Rock Centre, guests are treated to breathtaking views of the falls and the Niagara River, soaring 457 meters above the cascading waters. The scenic tour includes sights of Queen Victoria Park, Rainbow Bridge, and Horseshoe Falls from a unique vantage point.
name: Niagara Helicopters Limited
address: 3731 Victoria Ave, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6V5, Canada

excerpt: Orchids & tropical plants are in bloom at these picturesque gardens with seasonal floral displays.
detail_description: Located in Niagara Falls, the Floral Showhouse is a picturesque garden featuring a stunning display of orchids and tropical plants. The park is part of a network of beautiful gardens in the area, including the Centennial Lilac Garden, Floral Clock, Dufferin Islands, Oakes Garden Theatre, and Queenston Heights Park. Visitors can explore these attractions on foot or by bike along the scenic 56-kilometer Niagara River Recreational Trail.
name: Floral Showhouse
address: 7145 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6X8, Canada

excerpt: Museum with kitschy oddities on display, including shrunken human heads & rare animal skeletons.
detail_description: Located in the Clifton Hill district of Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada, Ripley's Believe It or Not! is an odditorium that showcases over 800 exhibits of bizarre and unusual items. Visitors can explore a collection of shrunken heads from Ecuador, a world-record-breaking assortment of pins and needles, and other peculiar artifacts. The museum offers a fun and intriguing look at the weird and wonderful world around us, providing an opportunity to discover things that may challenge one's beliefs.
name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
address: 4960 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N4, Canada

excerpt: Famous, towering waterfalls at the boundary of Canada & the United States, with tours & boat rides.
detail_description: Niagara Falls is a renowned natural wonder located at the border of Canada and the United States. It's a popular destination for tourists, offering boat rides and tours to experience its towering waterfalls. For those seeking a romantic getaway, a one-day tour from New York provides an opportunity to relax and explore this impressive site. Despite its popularity, Niagara Falls continues to captivate visitors with its majestic cascades.
name: Niagara Falls
address: NY 14303, USA

excerpt: 19th-century building featuring exhibits exploring local history, hands-on activities & a gift shop.
detail_description: The Niagara Falls History Museum, housed in a 19th-century building, offers a journey through local history with interactive exhibits and hands-on activities. Visitors can explore the civil, political, and geological history of the region, including displays on the War of 1812 and an interactive bridge-building exhibit. The museum also features a community gallery showcasing stories of those who have lived in the area. On Thursday nights after 5:00 p.m.
name: Niagara Falls History Museum
address: 5810 Ferry St, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 1S9, Canada

excerpt: Multisensory film experience detailing the history of Niagara Falls, with water & a moving platform.
detail_description: Niagara's Fury is a captivating and immersive 4D experience that delves into the history of Niagara Falls. The attraction, part of the recent $35 million renovation at Table Rock, offers a multisensory film detailing the creation of the falls. Visitors can expect to feel temperature drops, water bubbling and spraying, snow, and rumbling ground beneath them as they learn about the natural wonder.
name: Niagara's Fury
address: 6650 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 0L0, Canada

excerpt: Unobstructed, panoramic views of Niagara Falls are the major attraction at this observation deck.
detail_description: The Niagara Falls Observation Tower is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to soak in the stunning beauty of this natural wonder. Perched conveniently near the Maid of the Mist elevator, it offers breathtaking panoramic views that are simply unmatched. From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy unobstructed sights of the iconic falls and watch as boats navigate through the rushing waters below. The observation deck extends over the gorge, providing an exhilarating perspective on both the American Falls and Horseshoe Falls.
name: Niagara Falls Observation Tower
address: 332 Prospect St, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

detail_description: If you're seeking an exhilarating adventure during your visit to Niagara Falls, look no further than the WildPlay Niagara Falls Whirlpool Adventure Course. This thrilling experience invites you to conquer suspended obstacles and zip lines that soar high above the breathtaking whirlpool and gorge. Perfect for ages 5 and up, this course offers a unique way to test your balance while enjoying stunning views of one of nature's wonders.
name: WildPlay Niagara Falls Whirlpool Adventure Course
address: 3500 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 3G8, Canada

detail_description: Embark on an exhilarating adventure with Whirlpool Jet Boat Tours, one of the most thrilling activities at Niagara Falls. This 45-minute heart-pumping experience takes you through the powerful rapids and whirlpools of the Niagara River. You'll be equipped with a lifejacket and have the option to choose between getting completely soaked or staying dry during this adrenaline-pumping ride.
name: Whirlpool Jet Boat Tours
address: 55 River Frontage Road, Queenston, ON L0S 1L0, Canada

detail_description: Niagara Glen is a nature reserve with 4 km of rugged trails in the Niagara Gorge, offering stunning scenery and million-year-old rock formations. The area is home to endangered plant and animal life, as well as marine fossils. Hikers can explore eight fascinating trails along the edge of the Niagara River, experiencing the rush of the river and the ancient Niagara Whirlpool.
name: Niagara Glen
address: 132 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L0S 1J0, Canada

excerpt: Niagara Falls is a city on the Niagara River, in New York State. Its known for the vast Niagara Falls, which straddle the Canadian border. In Niagara Falls State Park, the Observation Tower, at Prospect Point, juts out over Niagara Gorge for a view of all 3 waterfalls. Trails from the Niagara Gorge Discovery Center lead to other viewpoints. The Aquarium of Niagara is home to Humboldt penguins, seals and sea lions.
detail_description: Niagara Falls, located on the Niagara River in New York State, is famous for its breathtaking waterfalls that straddle the Canadian border. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of all three waterfalls from the Observation Tower at Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park. The area offers plenty of adventure opportunities and attracts honeymooners and families alike. While there are numerous hotels in nearby Buffalo, options within Niagara Falls itself are limited but include self-catering apartments and traditional hotels with close proximity to the falls.
name: Niagara Falls
address: New York, USA

excerpt: Gambling facility with 1,300+ slot machines & 40 gaming tables, plus a sports bar.
detail_description: Located in Niagara Falls, Casino Niagara is a popular gambling facility that has been drawing visitors since its opening in 1996. It boasts over 1,300 slot machines and 40 gaming tables, offering games like Blackjack and sports betting. The venue also features a lively sports bar for guests to enjoy.
name: Casino Niagara
address: 5705 Falls Ave, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6T3, Canada

excerpt: Popular, long-running haunted house attraction with a multi-story maze format & souvenir photos.
detail_description: If you're seeking a spine-chilling adventure, look no further than Nightmares Fear Factory in Niagara Falls. This iconic haunted house has been thrilling visitors for years with its multi-story maze filled with terrifying special effects and creepy actors lurking around every corner. Set in the eerie remnants of an old coffin factory, this attraction boasts a haunting history that adds to its allure.
name: Nightmares Fear Factory
address: 5631 Victoria Ave, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3L5, Canada

excerpt: Accessible by Goat Island & known for its bridges & views of the upper rapids racing for the Falls.
detail_description: Nestled just off Goat Island, the enchanting Three Sisters Islands offer a delightful escape into nature's beauty. This captivating group of four small islandsnamed after General Parkhurst Whitney's daughtersfeatures charming footbridges that connect them, allowing visitors to wander through lush greenery and enjoy stunning views of the Upper Falls. The islands are steeped in legend, said to represent three Native American sisters who transformed into these landforms to safeguard themselves from danger.
name: Three Sisters Islands
address: Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

detail_description: Niagara River is a popular destination for families, couples, and sightseers in North America. It is located near the Horseshoe Falls and offers an exciting array of attractions such as the Niagara Speedway, Niagara Skywheel, and Hornblower Niagara Cruises. The river connects Lake Erie to Lake Ontario and has earned the nickname 'The Honeymoon Capital of the World' due to its global appeal.
name: Niagara River

excerpt: Whimsical house built upside down, with furniture & appliances arranged on the ceiling.
detail_description: The Upside Down House is a whimsical and unique landmark located on the Canadian side. Both the exterior and interior of the house are completely upside down, with furniture, appliances, and even shoes arranged on the ceiling. Visitors can explore about 5-6 rooms filled with hilarious photo opportunities due to this quirky setup. The optical illusion created by everything being upside down and the slight tilt of the house can cause dizziness but offers a fun experience for those looking for something different.
name: Upside Down House
address: 4967 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N5, Canada

detail_description: One of the top rated public golf courses in Canada, Whirlpool Golf Course is located in a picturesque setting beside the Niagara River Whirlpool. The course has been consistently ranked as one of Canada's best golf courses and is a great way to enjoy some championship golf while in Niagara Falls.
name: Whirlpool Golf Course
address: 3351 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L0S 1J0, Canada

detail_description: The Niagara Parks Power Station is a century-old engineering marvel that has harnessed the power of Horseshoe Falls to generate electricity. Visitors can explore the historic site and learn about its unique architecture, history, and the process of generating electricity from the falls. The station offers an immersive light show at night, providing a firsthand experience of its operation.
name: Niagara Parks Power Station
address: 7005 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L0S 1A0, Canada

excerpt: Enduring complex offering a retail mall, a multi-level indoor observation area & outdoor overlooks.
detail_description: The Table Rock Welcome Centre is a must-visit destination when exploring Niagara Falls, ON. Situated above the majestic Horseshoe Falls, it offers breathtaking panoramic views and serves as the starting point for the renowned Journey Behind the Falls tour. The center features a diverse range of attractions, including a retail mall, an indoor observation area with outdoor overlooks, and delightful dining options such as Pop & Lolly's Candy Shop.
name: Table Rock Welcome Centre
address: 6650 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6T2, Canada

excerpt: Lively indoor entertainment center with family-friendly arcade games & simulated rides.
detail_description: Great Canadian Midway is an exciting indoor entertainment center located on Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls. It offers a wide range of family-friendly arcade games and simulated rides, providing a lively atmosphere with dazzling lights and exciting sounds. Visitors can enjoy classic midway games like skee ball and more, with the opportunity to win tickets that can be redeemed for awesome prizes. The 70,000 square foot space is filled with over 300 games, ensuring endless entertainment for all ages.
name: Great Canadian Midway
address: 4848 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N4, Canada

excerpt: Amusement ride combining go-karts with a roller coaster-style track featuring spiral ramps.
detail_description: Niagara Speedway is a thrilling amusement ride that merges the excitement of go-karts with a roller coaster-style track, featuring spiral ramps and hairpin turns. Located in Clifton Hill, it's part of an array of attractions including the Niagara Skywheel and Hornblower Niagara Cruises. The Speedway offers a multi-level experience where visitors can test their driving skills on North America's largest elevated go-kart track.
name: Niagara Speedway
address: 4960 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N4, Canada

excerpt: Cavernous, rustic-chic brewpub serving its brand of craft beers, plus artisanal snacks & sliders.
detail_description: Located on the historic site of the Foxhead Inn, Niagara Brewing Company is a spacious and charming brewpub that offers a variety of craft beers and artisanal snacks. The brewery is renowned for its innovative beer selection, such as the Honeymoon Peach Radler with hints of ginger and a delightful peach finish, as well as the limited-edition Niagara Icewine Beer that combines traditional lager flavor with the sweetness of Icewine.
name: Niagara Brewing Company
address: 4915-A Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N5, Canada

excerpt: Landscaped city park housing the Brock & Laura Secord Monuments, picnic pavilions & a playground.
detail_description: Queenston Heights Park is a beautifully landscaped city park that features the Brock and Laura Secord Monuments, picnic pavilions, and a playground. It is part of the Niagara gardens which include various attractions such as the Parks Floral Showhouse, Centennial Lilac Garden, Floral Clock, Dufferin Islands, and Oakes Garden Theatre.
name: Queenston Heights Park
address: 14184 Niagara River Pkwy, Niagara-on-the-Lake, ON L0S 1J0, Canada

excerpt: Scenic park overlooks Niagara Whirlpool, with gorge hikes, fishing, picnicking & kids' play areas.
detail_description: Whirlpool State Park offers breathtaking views of the Niagara Whirlpool and the emerald green Niagara River. The park is a hiker's paradise, with extensive trails that lead to stunning vistas of the whitewater whirlpool and tree-covered gorge. Visitors can enjoy picnicking on the upper level, fishing, and exploring various safe access points to the river's edge. The park is also an ideal spot for capturing beautiful fall foliage and photographing the vibrant blue waters of the Niagara River Rapids.
name: Whirlpool State Park
address: Niagara Scenic Pkwy, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

excerpt: Niagara's iconic waterfalls are explored on film in a stadium-style theater with a 45-ft. screen.
detail_description: The Niagara Adventure Theater is a big movie theater that broadcasts movies about Niagara Falls in the wintertime. The movies are usually about interesting historical events that have happened at the Falls, and they're always very entertaining.
name: Niagara Adventure Theater
address: 21 Mayor Michael O'Laughlin Dr, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

detail_description: The Niagara Falls Underground Railroad Heritage Center, which opened in May 2018, is dedicated to sharing the authentic stories of abolitionists and freedom seekers in Niagara Falls. The center's permanent exhibition, "One More River to Cross," showcases the courageous actions of black residents and their role in the Underground Railroad. This museum serves as a poignant reminder of the struggles faced by enslaved individuals seeking sanctuary in Canada during the 19th century.
name: Niagara Falls Underground Railroad Heritage Center
address: 825 Depot Ave W, Niagara Falls, NY 14305, USA

excerpt: Scenic venue offers theater productions & concerts plus kid-friendly activities & family programs.
detail_description: ARTPARK, located in Lewiston, NY, is a 150-acre scenic venue that hosts over 150 performances annually from May through September. The park features indoor and outdoor stages with a stunning view of the Niagara Gorge. It offers a diverse lineup of events including theater productions, concerts by renowned artists like Patti LaBelle and Wilco, art installations, film screenings, dramatic performances, and festivals.
name: Artpark
address: 450 S 4th St, Lewiston, NY 14092, USA

detail_description: Luna Island, a lesser-known but captivating viewpoint, offers a distinctive and up-close experience as it is situated in the midst of the American Falls. Accessible via a pedestrian bridge from Goat Island, this scenic spot provides unobstructed views of the falls right at the brink. From here, visitors can witness the river's rush to the edge before plunging dramatically into the gorge below.
name: Luna Island
address: Goat Island Rd, Niagara Falls, NY 14303, USA

excerpt: Quirky haunted house attraction dedicated to the iconic Frankenstein monster.
detail_description: The House of Frankenstein is an iconic haunted house attraction dedicated to the iconic Frankenstein monster. It is situated in Niagara Falls, Ontario and is known for its breathtaking view of the falls. The employees are amazing and kind and the experience is a lot of fun.
name: The House of Frankenstein
address: 4967 Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, ON L2G 3N5, Canada
